channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for VA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for VA

item.title: Report I-2024040072
item.description:
Report I-2024040072

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-15T15:11:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-27
  • City: Petersburg
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: RSI LEASING, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 1
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Following the final transfer for the day, employee failed to close the bottom outlet valve on the tank car before attempting to disconnect the product hose form the tank car fitting. This resulted in the release of approximately 25 gallons of product. A nearby co-worker was able to close the valve completely minimizing the spill.

item.title: Report X-2024050508
item.description:
Report X-2024050508

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-14T15:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-10
  • City: STAUNTON
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: PACKAGE BROUGHT TO QA FOR DAMAGE INSPECTION FROM UNLOAD DURING INBOUND SORT WITH EXTERIOR AS PREVIOUSLY MARKED, LEAKING/POURING LIQUID OUT OF BOTTOM OF PLASTIC PAIL. UPON INSPECTION I FOUND PREVIOUSLY STATED ITEM DAMAGED/ABLE TO LEAK OUT OVER HALF DUE TO NO EXTERNAL PACKAGING FOR PROTECTION DURING SHIPPING ALLOWING CONTAINER TO BECOME CRACKED/LIDS TO BECOME LOOSE.

item.title: Report E-2024050206
item.description:
Report E-2024050206

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-13T15:12:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-07
  • City: CHESTER
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-Logistics contacted ERTS regarding a leaking 1.45L glass bottle of Potassium Hydroxide Solution. It is estimated that 1-quart leaked out to the outer cardboard as a result of a loose cap. A Contractor identified and overpacked the leaking product as well as the cardboard that was impacted. One 55-gallon DF was generated for waste disposal. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were impacted by this incident.
